abstract.text: Identify the price increase status for auto-renewable subscriptions in your app and on your server.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

metadata.title: Managing Price Increases for Auto-Renewable Subscriptions

inlineContent.text: If you increase the price of an auto-renewable subscription in App Store Connect, the
in the

object indicates if the subscription is subject to the price increase. Auto-renewable subscriptions have two types of price increases: those that require customer consent, and those that don’t require customer consent.
For price increases that require customer consent, look for the following status values in your app:
Indicates there’s no price increase for this auto-renewable subscription.
Indicates there’s a pending price increase for the auto-renewable subscription that requires customer consent, and the customer hasn’t yet consented.
If the customer doesn’t consent, the auto-renewable subscription expires at the end of the billing cycle. When it expires, your app gets a status update in
with an
of
Indicates that the customer consented to a price increase for the auto-renewable subscription.
For price increases that don’t require customer consent, look for the following status values in your app:
Doesn’t apply.
Doesn’t apply.
Indicates that the App Store informed the customer of the price increase for the auto-renewable subscription, and the subscription is subject to the price increase.
If the customer cancels the auto-renewable subscription, your app gets a status update in
with an
of
For more information about managing subscription prices in App Store Connect, see

content.text: Receive Notifications for Price Increase Status Events

inlineContent.text: If you’ve enabled
, your server receives notifications for events related to auto-renewable subscription price increases.
For auto-renewable subscription price increases that require customer consent, look for the following notifications:
Notification type
Subtype
Description
Indicates that the App Store informed the customer of the price increase for the auto-renewable subscription, and the customer hasn’t yet responded.
Indicates that the customer consented to the price increase for the auto-renewable subscription.
Indicates that the auto-renewable subscription expired because the customer didn’t consent to the price increase, and allowed the subscription to expire.
Indicates that the customer voluntarily canceled the auto-renewable subscription. (Note: This notification type and subtype isn’t specific to price increases.)
For auto-renewable subscription price increases that don’t require customer consent, look for the following notifications:
Notification type
Subtype
Description
Indicates that the App Store informed the customer of the auto-renewable subscription price increase, and the subscription is subject to the price increase.
Indicates that the customer voluntarily canceled the auto-renewable subscription. (Note: This notification type and subtype isn’t specific to price increases.)
For more information about App Store Server Notifications, see
. For more information about notification types and subtypes, see
and

abstract.text: Specify your secure server’s URL in App Store Connect to receive version 2 notifications.
The type that describes the in-app purchase or external purchase event for which the App Store sends the version 2 notification.
A string that provides details about select notification types in version 2.
Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Information about a product that you configure in App Store Connect.
Information about an auto-renewable subscription, such as its status, period, subscription group, and subscription offer details.
The renewal information for an auto-renewable subscription.
The auto-renewable subscription expired because the customer voluntarily canceled their subscription.
The subscription expired because the customer didn’t consent to an auto-renewable subscription price increase that requires customer consent.
Status values that indicate whether an auto-renewable subscription is subject to a price increase.
The auto-renewable subscription is subject to a price increase.
There’s no pending price increase for the auto-renewable subscription.
The customer hasn’t yet responded to an auto-renewable subscription price increase that requires customer consent.
The reason the auto-renewable subscription expired.
The status that indicates whether the auto-renewable subscription is subject to a price increase.
The renewal status information for an auto-renewable subscription.
The signed renewal information for the auto-renewable subscription.
The asynchronous sequence that emits status information when a subscription’s status changes.
Configure your server and provide an HTTPS URL to receive notifications about in-app purchase events and unreported external purchase tokens.
Offer content and services in your app across Apple platforms using a Swift-based interface.
